awd_titl_txt: IFIP Workshop (PROCOMET'98):  June 18-22, 1998,             Long Island, NY
awd_abstract_narration: 9714755  Gries  An international Working Conference on Programming Concepts  and Methods (PROCOMET '98) is held in Long Island, New York,  on 8-12 June 1998. The conference, organized by working  groups WG2.2 (Formal Description of Programming Concepts)  and WG2.3 (Programming Methodology) of IFIP (International  Federation for Information Processing), serves to foster  international interaction and cooperation on research topics  such as specification and verification of sequential, object-  oriented, and concurrent systems; logical and algebraic  foundations of specification and verification; and software  tools to support verification efforts. Up to 100 researchers  from a number of countries are expected to attend.  ***
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
